substrands.substrand_name: Careers in Creative Arts and Sports
specific_learning_outcomes: identify careers in Creative Arts and Sports
illustrate entrepreneurial opportunities in Creative Arts and Sports
appreciate careers in Creative Arts and Sports
suggested_learning_experiences: research, using digital devices or print material, to identify and discuss careers in Creative Arts and Sports

interact with actual or virtual Creative Arts spaces (theatre, recording studio, festivals, galleries, fine arts studios, workshops, exhibitions, cultural and sports centers) to observe roles performed by the personnel
watch videos/recording of entrepreneurial opportunities in Creative Arts and Sports
discuss to identify different entrepreneurial opportunities in Creative Arts and Sports
acknowledge own and others' talents and areas of career interest in Creative Arts and Sports
key_inquiry_questions: What are the career opportunities related to Creative Arts and Sports?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration - communication and collaboration; the learner enhances communication skills during research and collaborates with peers while discussing careers in Creative Arts and Sports
Learning to learn - research skills; the learner develops research skills as they search and organize information on careers in Creative Arts and Sports
values: Respect; the learner accommodates others opinions as they discuss the different personnel in Creative Arts and Sports in groups
Unity; the learner works with others in groups as they search for information on careers and personnel in Creative Arts and Sports
Responsibility; the learner uses digital devices appropriately while observing netiquette
pcis: Life Skills education: the learner gains decision making skills as they explore different careers in Creative Arts and Sports, with a view of identifying a career of interest
Social cohesion: the learner visits various Creative Arts and Sports spaces to interact with different personnel involved in Performing Arts activities
links_to_other_subjects: Pre-Technical Studies: the learner enhances digital skills as they research careers and develop entrepreneurial skills learn in business studies and they engage in income-earning performances

substrands.substrand_name: Components of Creative Arts and Sports
specific_learning_outcomes: describe the elements of a play
perform activities demonstrating the components of fitness
name pitches on the grand stave
group music notes in 4/4 time incorporating note extension
construct the scale of F major on a staff
appreciate the basic elements of Creative Arts and sports
suggested_learning_experiences: watch actual or virtual play performance to identify the elements of a play
discuss the basic elements of a play
observe actual or virtual activities of fitness that show power and reaction time in physical fitness
demonstrate fitness exercises that enhance power and reaction time
practice activities that enhance power and reaction time using music
draw the grand stave and name lines and spaces
draw the piano keyboard and relate to the grand stave
construct the scale of F major on both treble and bass staff
Construct F major on treble and bass staff ascending and descending (with and without Key signatures)
write signs for and tied dotted notes on a staff
play or sing scales F major ascending and descending and their tonic arpeggios
sight read simple melodies in C, G and F major for aural recognition of basic element of pitch
key_inquiry_questions: How does one create harmony pictorial composition?
Why should athletes avoid performance enhancers to develop physical fitness?
Why is note extension important in music notation?
core_competencies: Communication and Collaboration - articulation and sharing; the learner articulates and shares their understanding of various creative arts genres with peers and educators
Learning to Learn - independent research; the learner engages in independent research to understand the unique aspects of Creative Arts and Sports genres
Critical Thinking and Problem Solving - analysis; the learner engages in analysis of components and their roles in Creative Arts and Sports
values: Unity; the learner strengthens teamwork as they collaboratively research and do presentations on the components of Creative Arts and Sports
pcis: Mental Health: the learner participates in Creative Arts and Sports performances for fun and enjoyment to promote mental health and wellbeing
Identifying and Nurturing of Gifts and Talents: the learner identifies different components of Creative Arts and Sports
links_to_other_subjects: Mathematics: as the learner interacts with mathematical patterns to create rhythm in music

strands.strand_name: CREATING AND PERFORMING IN CREATIVE ARTS AND SPORTS

specific_learning_outcomes: discuss harmony/unity in a picture
classify analogous colors on a color wheel for painting
illustrate a colour gradation strip for color harmony
paint a scenery composition to express harmony/unity
appreciate own and others pictures
suggested_learning_experiences: observe pictures to review texture and colour; and discuss unity/harmony
paint a color wheel to classify analogous colours
paint line strip using a pair of analogous colors to study color harmony
research to sketch a composition inspired by the surrounding; a sea scape or landscape
paint a thin wash using the brush stroke technique to create a background
paint the scenery composition to express texture and color harmony/unity
collaboratively, display scenery composition in a working portfolio for peer feedback
key_inquiry_questions: Why is color classification important in painting?
How does the color affect the mood?
core_competencies: Communication and Collaboration - effective communication; The learner engages in effective communication by describing and discussing unity/harmony
Learning to Learn - active research; The learner actively researches/reviews on texture and color; and discuss unity/harmony
values: Respect; The learner respects the significance of Visual Arts by valuing the elements and principles as essential components of artistic expression and recognize the diverse interpretations of art
Unity; The learner collaborates with peers to display scenery composition in a working portfolio for peer feedback
pcis: Environmental Education: The learner appreciates the environment as they paint scenery composition inspired by the surroundings
links_to_other_subjects: Social Studies: The learner paints the scenery composition inspired by the environment to express texture and color harmony/unity

specific_learning_outcomes: describe the effect of note extension on rhythmic patterns
compose a four-bar rhythmic pattern in 4/4 time
notate four-bar rhythms in 4/4 time from dictation
appreciate rhythmic patterns as a means of creating interest in Creative Arts and Sports
suggested_learning_experiences: listen to, sing or play tunes involving dotted notes to outline effects of note extension in rhythmic patterns
beat time to familiar tunes in 4/4 time considering the crochet as principle beat, accented and weak beats
group notes of given two-bar rhythmic patterns involving dotted notes in 4/4 time
orally compose 4-bar rhythmic patterns involving dotted notes and their corresponding rests, in 4/4 time and write on monotone
write rhythmic patterns from dictation
sight read two-bar rhythms involving dotted notes in 4/4 time using French rhythm names
play two-part and imitative rhythmic patterns in 4/4 time using body percussion and percussion instruments
improvise rhythmic patterns to given tunes with rhythms involving dotted notes in 4/4 time
make a portfolio of all rhythmic patterns explored
key_inquiry_questions: How can various note combinations be used to form rhythms in simple time?
How can one improvise accompaniment patterns for Sports?
core_competencies: Communication and Collaboration - articulation and discussion; The learner, through effective communication, articulates and discusses the effect of note extension in rhythmic patterns, with peers
Learning to Learn - application of knowledge; The learner actively seeks to understand and apply notation conventions to represent rhythm in music
Critical Thinking and Problem Solving - creative problem solving; The learner creatively solves problems related to achieving the desired solutions on rhythmic structure in creating rhythmic patterns

Creativity and Imagination - exploration of innovative factors; The learner embraces creativity by exploring innovative factors such as unique combinations of beats, or experimental rhythmic elements as they create rhythmic patterns
values: Unity; the learner in collaborating with others on rhythm composition projects creates a harmonious atmosphere
Responsibility; the learner takes responsibility for their part in the ensemble while playing in unison or in two-part music, ensuring a coordinated and responsible musical performance
pcis: Ethnic and racial relations: the learner is acquainted with world music by learning notation and music interpretation
Health education: the learner gets insight into personal hygiene by cleaning and maintaining the instruments for use in playing rhythmic patterns
links_to_other_subjects: Mathematics: is involved in understanding the mathematical aspects of rhythm, such as beats per minute, time signatures, and mathematical relationships between dotted rhythmic elements
Integrated Science: Understanding the science of sound helps learners accurately notate rhythms, considering the physical properties of sound

specific_learning_outcomes: describe the phases in Triple jump
perform Triple jump for skill acquisition
identify long distance races in athletics
perform techniques for long distance running
explore characteristics of mosaic in sample pictures
create a mosaic pictorial composition inspired by an athletic event
acknowledge own and others' efforts in performing Triple jump, skills in long distance races and pictorial composition
suggested_learning_experiences: observe a live or virtual performance of Triple jump to identify the phases
demonstrate the approach, take off, flight and landing phases in Triple jump
practise triple jump skills in athletics
practise technique used in long distance running while observing safety
observe others' performance in Triple jump and long distance running skills and give feedback
collaboratively, play games or engage in athletic events where the skills and techniques in Triple jump and long distance running are applied
source for actual and virtual samples of mosaic work to analyze characteristics with focus on; mono media and spacing of materials
collect and prepare materials and tools for creating a mosaic focusing on material, support, and adhesive
sketch based on the theme 'athletics' on the support
collaboratively, make the mosaic composition with emphasis on; spacing of materials and color contrast (material vs support)
display and talk about own and others' mosaic composition and athletic skills
key_inquiry_questions: How has long distance running benefitted Kenya?
Why is it important to follow the phases of jumping in triple jump?
How can mosaic pictorial composition be used to improve the environment?
core_competencies: Learning to Learn - knowledge and feedback; the learner gains knowledge performing triple jump and long distance running skills and gives feedback to enhance confidence
Self-efficacy - confidence; the learner shows confidence in taking up new challenges and beliefs in performing new skills in athletics
Critical Thinking and Problem Solving - decision making; learners make decisions and decide on the skill to apply at a particular phase while running long distance
Creativity and Imagination - artistic creation; the learner creates an artistic themed mosaic composition for describing the long distance races
Citizenship - civic mindedness; the learner searches and makes a mosaic of Kenyan long distance athletes
values: Love; the learner shows love for the country as they identify and appreciate a Kenyan athlete and make a mosaic composition
Responsibility; the learner cares for self and others, as they participate in skills for long distance running and triple jump while observing safety
pcis: Social Cohesion: the learner engages in various creative arts and sports activities, appreciating the diverse cultures and values from different communities to enhance social cohesion
Citizenship: learner appreciates Kenyan athletes as they create mosaic compositions of their favorite Kenyan athletes
links_to_other_subjects: English: language skills are applied when the learner discusses different techniques in long-distance races, enhancing their ability to express ideas clearly
Mathematics: Analysing the pacing, speed, and strategies involved in long-distance races incorporates mathematical concepts into the learning process
Pre-Technical Studies: the learner interacts with digital devices when searching Kenyan athletes

specific_learning_outcomes: describe the use of variation in composing a melody
compose a four-bar melody in F Major and 4/4 time
notate four-bar melodies in 4/4 time
perform melodies in F major and 4/4 time
value the use of melody in Creative Arts and Sports
suggested_learning_experiences: sing familiar tunes and discuss how variation has been achieved in the different phrases of the melody
perform the scale of F major and its tonic arpeggio
write a 2-bar answering phrase in F major which is a variation of the given opening phrase in 4/4 time
improvise 2-bar opening phrases with variation in pitches to given answering phrases in 4/4 time and F major
create a four-bar melody in F major and in 4/4 time with varied phrases observing integrity
add phrase marks to the four-bar composed melodies indicating dynamics as loud for one phrase and soft for the other
sight read the melodies composed by self and others
listen to melodies written by self and others and give feedback
key_inquiry_questions: How can a melody be made interesting?
core_competencies: Creativity and Imagination - innovative techniques; The learner explores innovative techniques to create variation in melodies
Learning to Learn - application of knowledge; The learner applies knowledge gained from earlier grades on the process of melody composition
Communication and Collaboration - communication; The learner communicates with peers as they discuss how variation has been achieved in the different phrases of the melody
values: Unity; The learner collaborates with others in discussions about variation techniques in melody writing
Responsibility; The learner ensures accuracy and clarity in representing melodies, taking responsibility for conveying musical ideas effectively
Integrity; The learner strives to be true to their artistic vision, avoiding plagiarism and embracing originality in the creation of melodies
pcis: Moral Education: The learner sings familiar songs with messages on values as they discuss how variation has been achieved in the different phrases of the melody
links_to_other_subjects: Mathematics: The learner is involved in understanding the mathematical aspects of rhythm, such as beats per bar, time signatures, and mathematical relationships between different melodic elements
Integrated Science: The learner accurately notates melodies, considering the physical properties of sound

specific_learning_outcomes: distinguish passes in Rugby
perform passing skills in Rugby
perform kick techniques in Rugby
value own and others' efforts in applying passing and kicking skills for enjoyment
suggested_learning_experiences: watch a live, or virtual Rugby game to identify passes and kicks
demonstrate passing skills in Rugby
practise the spin, pop and basic passes in Rugby
demonstrate kicking skills in Rugby
practise the drop and place kick techniques in Rugby
use the skills of passing and kicking to play a modified game in Rugby while observing the rules of the game and safety
key_inquiry_questions: What are the best ways to advance a ball in a game of Rugby?
core_competencies: Communication and Collaboration - effective communication; The learner communicates by understanding and articulating the various types of passes in Rugby
Digital Literacy - use of technology; the learner interacts with digital devices to observe virtual performances in Rugby, to enhance appropriate use of technology
Creativity and Imagination - creative ways; the learner devises creative ways of advancing the ball with passes to outsmart the opponents during play
values: Integrity; The learner upholds a high standard of integrity by respecting the rules of the game and engaging in skill acquisition with honesty and transparency
Unity; The learner strengthens teamwork as they collaboratively play rugby games
pcis: Physical Fitness: the learner develops physical fitness through rugby skills practice
Safety Education: the learner observes safety while practicing rugby skills
links_to_other_subjects: Integrated Science: Exploring the science behind different kicking techniques incorporates principles of force, motion, and anatomy
English: language skills are utilized when learners communicate and distinguish types of passes in Rugby, enhancing their ability to express ideas clearly

specific_learning_outcomes: identify different viewpoints in photography
take photographs of a scenery in different viewpoints for showcase
present the photographs for appreciation
suggested_learning_experiences: observe virtual and actual samples of photographs to analyze the bird's, normal and worm's viewpoints
research/take a field walk to explore and identify scenic point in the surroundings
take photographs inspired by the environment to showcase beautiful scenes in our country (Kenya) focusing on; varied scene and viewpoints
select and store the photographs in an e-folder to make a still/slide presentation
make a presentation for own reflection and peer feedback in a just manner
key_inquiry_questions: Which are the ethical issues to consider in photography?
core_competencies: Citizenship - appreciation for country; learner visits their surroundings to take photographs to showcase beautiful scenes in our country (Kenya)

Imagination and Creativity - evaluation and selection; learner evaluates and selects photographs, considering different viewpoints and perspectives, and makes informed decisions during the editing process
values: Respect; learner presents their photographs and gives feedback in a just manner
pcis: Environmental Awareness: learner appreciates beautiful environment as they take a field walk to explore and identify scenic point in the surroundings
links_to_other_subjects: Social Studies: Understanding the geographical and environmental aspects of different viewpoints in landscape photography

specific_learning_outcomes: identify the fingering of notes in the scale of F major
play the scale of F major from staff notation on a descant recorder
perform a solo piece in F major on a descant recorder, applying correct playing techniques
value playing music on the descant recorder
suggested_learning_experiences: read, and interpret fingering charts to play the notes of F major scale
play the scale of F Major ascending and descending on staff notation
play simple melodies in the scale of F major on staff notation
watch actual or virtual instrumental tutorials to demonstrate and explain techniques of pinching on a descant recorder
explore actual or virtual demonstrations of playing techniques of descant recorder to explain performance directions for dynamics crescendo and diminuendo
play simple melodies in 4/4 time, and in F major observing performance directions for dynamics
use digital devices responsibly to record performances for future reference
key_inquiry_questions: What is the importance of applying technique when playing instrumental music?
core_competencies: Self-Efficacy - confidence; The learner confidently reads and interprets fingering charts as they play the notes of F major scale
Creativity and Imagination - performance directions; The learner plays simple melodies in 4/4 time, and in F major observing performance directions for dynamics
values: Responsibility; The learner acquires self-discipline as they use digital devices to record performances for future reference
Social justice; The learner observes safety as they clean and play instruments
pcis: Self-awareness: The learner identifies skills they are good at and connects them with their talents in instrumental playing
links_to_other_subjects: Integrated Science: The learner understands the science of sound production to enhance comprehension of playing techniques, especially regarding the impact on the quality of sound
Pre-technical and Business Studies: The learner acquires concepts and procedures for understanding technical aspects in assembling, playing, caring for and maintaining the Descant Recorder they play

specific_learning_outcomes: describe the format of a play script
create a one act play addressing a social issue
act a role in a play performance
recognise play performance as a channel of addressing social issues
suggested_learning_experiences: read a sample play to identify the format of a script
brainstorm, in groups, an idea for a short play
create a short play script using the play elements
select relevant prop(s), costumes and music for the play performance
perform vocal and physical warm up activities in preparation for play performance
rehearse a role in the play (paying attention to use of voice, body, movement, space, use of props, music, and costume)
perform a role in a play performance before an audience
record experiences in a journal
key_inquiry_questions: How can a play performance be made believable to an audience?
Why is it important to decorate props to be used for performance?
core_competencies: Communication - speaking clearly; the learner speaks clearly during class discussions and when acting in a play
Collaboration - group activities; the learner participates in group activities when creating and performing in a play

Creativity and Imagination - observation and experimentation; the learner sharpens observation skills of the environment to note challenges in society and to experiment with new ideas for addressing these challenges using play performance
Critical thinking and problem solving - problem identification; the learner develops problem identification skills and conflict resolution mechanisms when creating and performing a play
Citizenship - civic mindedness; the learner develops a sense of civic mindedness and social awareness in creating and performing plays which address societal concerns
Digital literacy - use of digital gadgets; the learner interacts with digital devices when selecting and using music for the play performance
values: Responsibility; the learner develops skills of self-drive, accountability and determination while creating and performing a play
Social Justice; the learner fosters fairness and justice while working in groups and through creation of fictional works
Peace; the learner works in harmony with others during rehearsal and performance sessions
Integrity; the learner is equipped with the value of honesty through the creation of own original works devoid of plagiarism
pcis: Learner support programs: the learner identifies and nurtures talent in acting or any other role in play performance
Life skills education: the learner gains self-esteem and assertiveness while performing on stage
Citizenship Education: the learner uses the play performance space to create awareness about societal issues
links_to_other_subjects: English and Kiswahili: the learner takes part in class discussions using these languages as media for communication
Pre-technical Studies: the learner uses computer literacy skills to manipulate digital gadgets in play creation and performance
Religious Studies: the learner performs plays which advocate for social and moral values in society

specific_learning_outcomes: perform passes in Basketball for skill acquisition
execute dribbling in Basketball for skill acquisition
design logo for a Basketball team
appreciate each other's skills in Basketball game
suggested_learning_experiences: watch a live or virtual Basketball game and identify the passing and dribbling skills in Basketball
demonstrate the overhead, bounce and chest passes in Basketball
demonstrate high and low dribbling in Basketball
practice passing and dribbling skills while observing safety
research to examine actual or virtual samples of a logo
design a logo for a basketball team, name/letter combination
apply the skills learned in Basketball in a mini-Basketball game in teams displaying the team logos
display the logo around the basketball pitch for appreciation
key_inquiry_questions: How can a poster be made an effective means of communicating?

Creativity and Imagination - creation; the learner creates an identification logo for the basketball teams
Communication and Collaboration - sharing ideas; the learner communicates and shares ideas on the different basketball passes when practicing different basketball passes

Integrity; the learner exhibits integrity by following the rules and ethical guidelines of the game and observes safety measures during mini games and handling sharp tools while trimming and fixing the posters

specific_learning_outcomes: describe coil techniques in pottery

make a frame loom for weaving
make a fabric using 2/1 twill weaving technique
display and critique own and others' woven articles

source clay and prepare clay by removing impurities, drying, kneading and wedging
make coils of uniform thickness
join clay coils to form a vessel
smoothen the inside and outside of the vessel
decorate the slightly dry vessel by incising and dry under shade
collaboratively fire the completely dry vessel using an open pit kiln
explore actual and virtual resources to study making a frame loom and 2/1 twill weaves
collaboratively, make a wooden mitre joint frame loom, (equal spacing of nails)
secure the warps on the loom and interlace the wefts using 2/1 twill techniques to weave a fabric
display and talk about own and peers' articles
key_inquiry_questions: Why is clay the preferred material for pottery?

core_competencies: Creativity and Imagination - making fabric; the learner makes a fabric using 2/1 twill weaving technique
Communication and Collaboration - firing vessel; the learner collaboratively fires the bone dry vessel using an open pit kiln
Self-efficacy - display and talk; the learner displays and talks about own and peers' articles
values: Respect; the learner gains respect for others' opinions while creating and sharing own and peers' articles
Responsibility; the learner acquires self-discipline when making a wooden mitre joint frame loom
Patriotism; the learner gains appreciation for Indigenous Kenyan Crafts through interaction with pottery items from actual and virtual sources
pcis: Hygiene and safety: the learner fires the bone dry vessel using an open pit kiln observing safety
Environmental conservation: the learner sources clay and prepares clay responsibly
links_to_other_subjects: Agriculture: the learner sources clay thus understanding types of soils

perform the butterfly stroke in swimming

demonstrate the phases of standing dive
practise standing dive while observing safety
demonstrate the phases of butterfly stroke
practise the butterfly stroke while observing safety and coordination
practise combination of standing dive and butterfly stroke
key_inquiry_questions: How can swimming skills be performed safely?

core_competencies: Self-Efficacy - confidence; the learner develops confidence through mastery and performing skills in swimming

Communication and Collaboration - group work; the learner works in a group to practice different swimming skills
values: Unity; the learner works in a team as they play during swimming
Responsibility; the learner handles the swimming equipment with care and keeps them well after use
Respect; the learner takes turns to demonstrate the skills in swimming

Safety and security: enhanced as the learner wears suitable swimming clothing and ensures that the pool area is safe

practice skills in different indigenous board games while observing safety

Learning to Learn - acquiring and mastering skills; the learner acquires and masters skills in indigenous board games

Unity; the learner works with others in indigenous board games

strands.strand_name: APPRECIATION IN CREATIVE ARTS AND SPORTS

substrands.substrand_name: Analysis of Creative Arts and Sports
specific_learning_outcomes: analyse a play performance
examine ethical practices in sports
analyse a solo vocal piece of music
critique exhibited artworks for inspiration
appreciate the role of analysis in adding value to Creative Arts and Sports
suggested_learning_experiences: research on the criteria for evaluating a play
analyse a given play performance to evaluate theme, setting, conflict, resolution, use of voice, use of body movement, internalisation, audience involvement, props, costume, overall impression
discuss ethical issues in Sports (Anti-doping)
research on how to analyze a solo vocal piece of music
listen to and analyze a solo vocal piece of music
visit community/online galleries to see and analyze artworks
create a catalog of the exhibited artworks
discuss to reflect on the work of art for inspiration and mentorship
discuss ethical issues in Creative Arts
key_inquiry_questions: Why is analysis an important skill in Creative Arts and Sports?
How can analysis of creative arts and sports enhance creativity?
core_competencies: Self-Efficacy - confidence in evaluation; the learner gains confidence in their ability to evaluate and appreciate diverse forms of artistic expression as they apply their knowledge and skills to assess the artistic merits of visual representations in these arts
Citizenship - cultural citizenship; the learner exhibits cultural citizenship by exploring and understanding the cultural context and significance of the folk song
values: Unity; Through collaborative efforts in understanding diverse perspectives, the learner contributes to a sense of unity within the learning community
Integrity; The learner approaches the evaluation task with integrity, ensuring honesty and principled assessments that contribute to the ethical critique of artistic expression
pcis: Life Skills: the learner develops analytical and creative thinking as they discuss and critique the Creative Arts and Sports areas
Learner Support Programs: the learner exercises fair play as they critique and give honest opinions respectfully of their own and other's displayed disciplines
links_to_other_subjects: English and Kiswahili: language skills are essential in articulating and expressing thoughts when examining and discussing criteria for Creative Arts and Sports evaluation
Social Studies: perspectives can be applied to understand the historical, cultural, and sociological context of the solo vocal song and its significance within the community
